item.description: Biography I am currently a staff scientist in the “Applied Mathematics and Plasma Physics” group at Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL). Previously, I was a post-doctoral research associate at Center for Nonlinear Studies (CNLS), LANL. My primary research interests include development of efficient formulations and algorithms for modeling, design and control of complex physical systems. Particularly, I utilize tools from a myriad of disciplines including, mathematical programming and optimization (convex and nonconvex), control theory and uncertainty quantification.
